channel.title: "Admins can't trade." [562]
channel.description: How do you set trade limits so that admins can trade? I have a 562.

item.title: "Admins can't trade." [562]
item.dc:creator: @xXThatOneSkaterKidXx xXThatOneSkaterKidXx
item.description:
@xXThatOneSkaterKidXx wrote:

If it works I’[quote=“Skiire, post:6, topic:438442”][quote author=xXThatOneSkaterKidXx link=topic=541161.msg3963942#msg3963942 date=1333521845]
So it should read:

if(playerRightsAdministrator >= 2) {
printMessage(“Admins can’t trade.”);
}
[/quote]

Similar to that, yes. Also I modified my previous post, so take a look at that.

I’m going to bed for the night, good luck fixing this, if you still need help tomorrow send me a PM.[/quote]

If it works I’ll Rep++ you

Read full topic

item.title: "Admins can't trade." [562]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“xXThatOneSkaterKidXx, post:3, topic:438442”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=541161.msg3963930#msg3963930 date=1333521048]
Create a boolean check.

If a player has the rights of an administrator set their ability to trade to false.
[/quote]

I have owner rights and everytime I trade my brother it tells me “Admins can’t trade.”

how do I make a boolean?[/quote]

If you have owner rights and it’s still saying that then the way it’s constructed is incorrect.

if(playerRightsAdministrator >= 2) {
printMessage("Admins can't trade.");
}

Something similar to that is what’s happening. Remove the > and replace with =.

Anyways this is how you can make a boolean:

if(playerAdmin){
   //Executes when the Boolean expression is true
}else{
   //Executes when the Boolean expression is false
   printMessage("Admin's can't trade.");
}

Will have to declare the boolean and then modify that code to work with your source, I’ve never used a higher revision so I couldn’t tell you how it works out.

Read full topic
